required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of PPV23 Vaccine Revaccinated in 60-70 Years Old
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ⅳ Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of 23 Valent Pneumococcal Polysaccharide Vaccine Revaccinated in 60-70 Years Old in Shanghai

lead_sponsor.agency: China National Biotec Group Company Limited

collaborator.agency: Shanghai Municipal Center for Disease Control and Prevention

clinical_study.source: China National Biotec Group Company Limited

brief_summary.textblock: Objective: To evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of PPV23 vaccine revaccinated in 60-70 years old in Shanghai.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Study group is PPV23 revaccination and control group PPV23-vaccination.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The blood collection time was 28-40 days after vaccination.
primary_outcome.description: The difference of serum antibody double growth level between the two groups was compared.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The blood collection time was 28-40 days after vaccination.
secondary_outcome.description: The difference of serum antibody GMC level between the two groups was compared.
Adverse reactions were collected during the observation period.

arm_group.description: The subjects in the study group had been vaccinated with 23 valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine made in China for more than 5 years.
The control group had never been vaccinated with any pneumococcal vaccine.

intervention.description: The study group and the control group were vaccinated with one dose of vaccine and blood was collected after 28-40 days.

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Municipal Center for Disease Control and Prevention

facility.name: Shanghai municipal center for disease control and prevention
